The '''Evil Breath''' was "an evil wind out of Angband" that brought a sickness to [[Dor-lómin]] under a leaden sky.<ref>{{S|Turin}}</ref><ref name="Childhood">{{CH|1}}</ref>

== History ==
In the autumn of {{FA|469}}, many had hope that [[Maedhros]] would turn back [[Morgoth]], sealing the [[Gates of Angband|Doors of Angband]]. Yet those that were wiser feared that new evils will be devised in Angband. Their fears were true, as "an ill wind from the [[Northlands|North]]", known only as the Evil Breath, brought a pestilence to those lands that bordered [[Anfauglith]]. Many of those that perished from the sickness were the rising youth and children.<ref name="Childhood"/>

Before the ending of that year, the Evil Breath had reached [[Dor-lómin]], striking [[Túrin]] with a fever and dark dreams. Due to his fate and strength, he survived the sickness. His sister, [[Urwen]], was not spared however, and Túrin wept bitterly alone that night, grieving for her.<ref name="Childhood"/>

Later, Túrin mentions the Evil Breath during a conversation he has with [[Sador]], considering it to have been a curse by the [[Morgoth|wicked King]].<ref name="Childhood"/>
